name: Fossil Butte National Monument
description: In the ridges of southwest Wyoming are some of the best-preserved fossils in the world. They tell the story of ancient life in a warm, wet environment in and around a freshwater lake. Stingrays swam in the lake. Turtles basked in the sun. Leaves rustled in the breeze while early horses darted between the trunks. We reveal more of the past with each fossil found.
shortDescription: In the ridges of southwest Wyoming are some of the best-preserved fossils in the world. They tell the story of ancient life in a warm, wet environment in and around a freshwater lake. Stingrays swam i...

operatingHours.description:
Visitors may enter the park any day sunrise to sunset, but visitor services and motor vehicle access vary throughout the year. 
Camping is not available.

climate.weatherDescription: Expect a variety of weather conditions no matter what time of year you visit. Spring, fall and winter can be very cold with snow and icy conditions. In spring, daytime temperatures usually range from 30 F to 65 F. Summer daytime temperatures range from 60 F to 90 F. Fall daytime temperatures range from 45 F to 70 F. Winter daytime temperatures range from -20 F to 30 F.

images.title: Fossils on the Ridge
images.altText: Fish fossils, Knightia eocaena, exposed near cliff
images.caption: Knightia eocaena, the most abundant vertebrate fossil in the world, lies exposed near cliff face.

images.title: Cockerellites liops, a Common Fossil Fish
images.altText: a well preserved fossil fish, Cockerellites liops
images.caption: Fossils from the Green River Formation are known for their excellent preservation, abundance, and diversity. Cockerellites liops is one of the common fishes found here.

images.title: Palm Frond
images.caption: Fossil palm fronds and other plants indicate a climate similar to the Gulf Coast states.

images.title: The Limestone Ridges, Remnants of Ancient Fossil Lake, Contrast the Green, Early Summer Landscape.
images.altText: A scenic view of Fossil Basin in early summer; yellow limestone, red mudstones and green vegetation
images.caption: Early Summer Beauty in the High Desert of Southwestern Wyoming

images.title: Visitor Center
images.altText: visitor center with Fossil Butte in the background
images.caption: The visitor center is nestled in a sagebrush landscape beneath Fossil Butte. Over 300 fossils are on exhibit.

images.title: Moonrise Over Fossil Butte
images.altText: The moon rises just to the right of snow-covered Fossil Butte.
images.caption: Fossil Butte is the most noticeable landmark of the park and where the monument got its name.
